ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] unable to run H3-beta in non-webui mode
ygData.msgSnippet: Heritrix 3 always launches with the web interface for monitoring and remote-control, and so your choice of administrator credentials must always be supplied at

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] unable to run H3-beta in non-webui mode
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=q54pw4kPAR3lj5dA6GFshVNLF-ROsYDLD0rqpZazwg9W
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Heritrix 3 always launches with the web interface for monitoring and 
remote-control, and so your choice of administrator credentials must 
always be supplied at launch.

H3 does not yet offer a command-line option equivalent to '-r' for 
immediately running a given job. We could restore such an option, if 
people need it.

In the meantime, the same immediate-launch effect is easy via a followup 
web-request. For example, if you have the 'curl' command-line web client 
available, this should work:

% bin/heritrix -a myname:mypassword
...
% curl -v -d "action=launch" -k -u myname:mypassword --anyauth 
--location https://localhost:8443/engine/myjobname

(Security note: if connecting to a remote Heritrix, rather locally via 
'localhost', you would need to tell Heritrix to listen on external 
interfaces with the '-b' switch, and you would want to configure curl to 
accept your crawler's certificate, according to the curl documentation, 
rather than using the '-k' insecure switch, to be certain you only 
connect and login to the right remote service.)

- Gordon @ IA
